abstract: In separate suits, New York’s attorney general and the United States attorney in Manhattan say the bank it overcharged customers almost $2 billion in foreign transactions.
snippet: In separate suits, New York’s attorney general and the United States attorney in Manhattan say the bank it overcharged customers almost $2 billion in foreign transactions.
lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general and the United States attorney in Manhattan filed separate lawsuits on Tuesday against the Bank of New York Mellon, accusing it of cheating state and other pension funds nationwide out of foreign exchange fees over the last decade.
